green.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: having the colour of grass or leaves
green.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
green.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: covered with grass, trees, bushes etc
green.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: not yet ready to be eaten, or very young
green.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: tiny green shoots of new grass
green.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: connected with the environment or its protection
green.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: green issues such as the greenhouse effect and global warming
He was an early champion of green politics.
green.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: harming the environment as little as possible
green.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: We need to develop greener cleaning products.
The industry has promised to go green (=change so that it harms the environment less).
green.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: I was pretty green then; I had a lot of things to learn.
green.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: looking pale and unhealthy because you are ill
green.translation[0].definitions[6].note: look green about/around the gills (=look pale and ill)
green.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: George looked a bit green the next morning.
green.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the colour of grass and leaves
green.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a room decorated in pale blues and greens
green.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a level area of grass, especially in the middle of a village
green.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I walked home across the green.
green.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a smooth flat area of grass around each hole on a golf course
green.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: someone who belongs to or supports a political party which thinks the protection of the environment is very important
green.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The Greens have 254 candidates in the election.
green.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to fill an area with growing plants in order to make it more attractive
green.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Existing derelict land is needed for greening the cities.
green.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to make a person or organization realize the importance of environmental problems
green.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: connected with protecting the environment or harming it as little as possible
green.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: These revelations will damage the companyâ€™s green image.
Voters see very little difference between the main political parties on green issues.
